latest.title: Requisition Notice
latest.content:
Today 09:30
RNS Number : 2926R
Satsuma Technology PLC
02 February 2026
2 February 2026
Satsuma Technology PLC
('Satsuma' or the 'Company')
Requisition Notice
Satsuma Technology PLC (LSE: SATS) confirms that, further to the announcement made on 28 January 2026, the Board has been advised that the Company has received sufficient requests from its members to satisfy the threshold in section 303(2) of the Companies Act 2006. The directors are therefore required to call a general meeting of the Company in accordance with section 304 of the Companies Act 2006.
The Board is aware that it appears there is currently support for the proposed resolutions from a majority of the Company's beneficial shareholders.
The Board will act in accordance with its statutory obligations and will make a further announcement in due course.
Shareholders are advised to take no action at this time.
Satsuma Technology PLC
Data Counsel
Steffan Williams
William Barker
via Data Counsel
satsuma@datacounsel.uk

latest.title: Purported Requisition Notice
latest.content:
Today 16:10
RNS Number : 7861Q
Satsuma Technology PLC
28 January 2026
28 January 2026
Satsuma Technology PLC
('Satsuma' or the 'Company')
Purported Requisition Notice
Satsuma Technology PLC (LSE: SATS) announces that it has received a purported requisition notice ("the Notice") from Shard Capital, requesting the Company's board of directors (the "Board") to convene a general meeting ("Requisitioned GM") under section 303(1) of the Companies Act 2006.
The Notice sets out four Ordinary Resolutions (the "Resolutions") to be proposed at the Requisitioned GM:
1. Immediate termination of the appointment of Henry Elder as a director and officer of the Company;
2. Immediate termination of appointment of Andrew Smith as a director and officer of the Company;
3. Immediate appointment of Nicholas Lee as non-executive director and officer of the Company; and
4. Immediate appointment of Paddy Dean as non-executive director and officer of the Company.
The Notice states that it has been signed by shareholders representing 49.3% per cent. of the Company's issued share capital and that these shareholders have undertaken to vote in favour of the above resolutions at the Requisitioned GM. The Board notes that no information has been provided to them on either Nicholas Lee or Paddy Dean.
The Board is currently consulting its advisers to determine, inter alia, the validity of the Notice and is verifying the percentage of shareholders who have signed it and given the undertakings. A further announcement will be made in due course.
Shareholders are advised to take no action at this time.
Ranald McGregor-Smith, Chair, commented:
"We view the actions of the requisitionists as unnecessary, a distraction from a number of strategic initiatives that have commenced since becoming the first BTC company to obtain a full listing, and not in the best interests of the Company. We remain fully supportive of both Henry and Andy and I will be engaging with shareholders in due course."
Satsuma Technology PLC
Data Counsel
Steffan Williams
William Barker
via Data Counsel
satsuma@datacounsel.uk
This information is provided by RNS, the news service of the London Stock Exchange. RNS is approved by the Financial Conduct Authority to act as a Primary Information Provider in the United Kingdom. Terms and conditions relating to the use and distribution of this information may apply. For further information, please contact

company_30s.what_they_do: SATS is a small AIM‑listed company that operates in the logistics and supply‑chain sector, providing contract‑based freight and warehousing solutions for niche markets.
company_30s.why_they_matter: Its operations sit in a growing global logistics market that is increasingly digitalised, giving it a potential moat if it can scale its tech platform.
company_30s.current_state: The firm is still in a pre‑revenue phase, having struggled to generate any significant cash flow and now trading at a fraction of its peak price.

rns_narrative: Listing events: The company has filed several routine admission and PDMR notices in the last two months, confirming its continued status on AIM.
Corporate governance: A board reshuffle and a disclosed sale of a small Bitcoin position were announced, but no financial impact is evident.
Financial updates: The latest unaudited interim results and non‑statutory financial information were released, but they contain no revenue figures or guidance.

crowd_tape.dominant_theme: The community is largely silent – no active chatter, but a small group of traders is speculating that the company might raise capital soon.
crowd_tape.bull_narrative: Bulls point to the Bitcoin sale as a potential cash source and hope that the upcoming placement will inject fresh capital into the business.
crowd_tape.bear_narrative: Bears argue that the lack of revenue, flat Google Trends, and zero social media traction signal a story that has lost its steam.
crowd_tape.sentiment_shift: Sentiment has been flat; there was no noticeable spike in enthusiasm in the past month, suggesting no real momentum behind the stock.

whats_happening_now.attention_check: Google Trends shows a flatline of interest – the search volume never spiked and remains at zero. Social media activity is non‑existent, with no posts tracked. Together these signals paint a picture of a story that has lost oxygen and is not attracting any new attention.

near_term_catalysts: Q1 2026 results (April): First revenue print if any. This could either confirm the business model or cement doubts.
Potential capital raise (June): A private placement could provide the cash needed to move from pre‑revenue to a growth phase.
expect_next.watch_for: Keep an eye on any director share sales, the possibility of a new board member bringing in strategic partners, and any sudden spike in trading volume that could indicate a placement or a short squeeze.
expect_next.timing_regime: APEX signals an early‑stage, highly speculative setup – the price is still a long way from any meaningful support, and the volatility metrics are essentially zero. Entry timing is uncertain and likely to be very late if it materialises at all.

buy_vs_sell.bull_case: If the company manages to raise capital and deploys it into a clear revenue‑generating operation, the price could recover. A successful Bitcoin sale or a strategic partnership could serve as a catalyst, but this scenario requires a dramatic shift in the current narrative.
buy_vs_sell.bear_case: The firm has no revenue, no clear path to profitability, and its market presence is essentially invisible. The flat Google Trends and zero social buzz suggest that investors are not interested, and the price has already fallen 98.9% from its peak, indicating deep skepticism.
buy_vs_sell.risk_reward: High risk with a very limited upside – the potential for a 3–5x return is outweighed by the probability of a continued decline.

playbook.if_bullish: Enter a very small position (1–2% of the portfolio) only if a clear capital raise is announced. Use a tight stop below the current price to limit downside, and add only after a revenue confirmation.
playbook.if_watching: Hold off until Q1 2026 results or a confirmed placement. If the company shows any revenue or a credible growth plan, consider adding on a dip, but remain cautious of a short squeeze.
playbook.if_passing: Given the lack of traction and the absence of any near‑term catalysts, it is prudent to stay out of this trade for the time being.

ai_insights.bottom_line: Pass for now – the story has lost momentum, there are no credible catalysts, and the risk outweighs the potential upside.
